post0.title: COVID-19 Confirmed Cases vs. Deaths
post0.content: Estimated actual infection time vs detected infection time . Following the estimations in the widely-shared Medium post from Tomas Pueyo [1], we assume the average time from infection to death at 20 days. This is used to estimate the time of the infections that lead to the observed deaths. Assuming a fatality rate of 1% allows us to estimate the number of infections that are responsible for the observed deaths. . [1] https://medium.com/@tomaspueyo/coronavirus-act-today-or-people-will-die-f4d3d9cd99ca . Cummulative confirmed cases per deaths . click the country label that you want to highlight. Shift + click to compare different countries. . Growth of confirmed cases compared to deaths . Some countries test faster than others. Solid lines show the number of confirmed cases, dashed lines the number of deaths. The further the two lines are apart on the x-axis, the faster a country starts testing its population. . Here, we measure the distance of the day of the maximum number of reported deaths to the number of confirmed cases timeline. . Text(0.5, 1.0, 'All') .
